Author: tolken#2655
Content: Can anyone please take a look at my question in #dev-marketmaker regarding client_osx. Bdex cli seeing my ltc, bch, btc, but not kmd. It shows kmd as active and right address when I enable it, but won‚Äôt show a balance. I installed Agama to get Komodod. I guess the meat of the question is: Why is Bdex seemly expecting all of my coins in ‚Äúlibrary/Application Suppost/library/Application Support‚Äù ? It‚Äôs like something is nesting/doubling the path. I redirected all of my ltc, btc, etc to this odd path, which worked but not kmd.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Coins.json seems to have paths for most coins so you can explicitly define a path there o guess, but I don‚Äôt seem to be able to find a path for the kmd one.  Is it there or somewhere else?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Yesterday, after syncing the KMD blockchain to my computer, I tried to shut down agama.

However, it has been in the shut down mode for almost a full 24 hours now. It has that message saying, "This may take a while depending on the state of your files and daemon" or something. 

A long time ago I force shut it down during this process and it corrupted files (on another setup). 

How long do you suggest I wait before killing Agama and rebooting?

Author: cipi#4502
Content: @tolken `Empty reply from serve` is from 127.0.0.1:7783, your own marketmaker... means likely mm process is not running

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @Bryan_Beus  did you tried shutting Agama down by first pressing stop on the Daemon by selecting it from the drop down menu next to the coin?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: I just hit the `x` in the upper right corner of the window

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: yep for future interactions press stop on the daemon before doing that because that can corrupt files because is not shutting down correctly.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: it has to stop first and then you could close it

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Hmm, seems like this is something we need to fix.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Thank you, I'll kill it soon and switch to doing that next time.
